title: 104_hr3117
content: AUTHORITY TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE MANAGED HEALTH-CARE PLANS. The Secretary may establish and operate managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. These plans can be operated through Department health-care facilities and may involve partnerships with other public or private entities. The plans must adhere to standards set by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary can establish managed health care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, in partnership with public or private entities. The plans must meet standards set by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services. Minimum health care benefits for veterans enrolled in the plan should include those covered under Medicare. The Secretary may enroll veterans in the plan and set cost-sharing requirements. The Secretary may establish an enrollment system for veterans in managed health care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. Cost-sharing requirements may be set to cover benefits not paid by Medicare, including an enrollment premium, copayments, and deductibles. Payments received for care provided to veterans in these plans will be credited to the Department's medical appropriation. The Social Security Act allows for cost-sharing requirements in health-care plans for veterans, including enrollment premiums, copayments, and deductibles. Payments received for care provided to veterans will be used to cover costs and must be certified by the facility director before operating a plan. The facility director must certify sufficient funds for medical care to provide hospital care and services to veterans in need. A new item is added to the table of sections in the chapter. Establishment of managed health-care plans. Requirement for payment for certain services provided by department facilities. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make Medicare payments for certain veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans. This includes veterans who are Medicare-eligible individuals and not described in section 1710(a)(1) of the title. The payments are made under similar terms as payments to other eligible managed care health plans under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for certain veterans enrolled in Department managed health care plans. These plans, organized under section 1705, are certified as Medicare Choice organizations under section 1857 of the Social Security Act. The Secretary certifies compliant plans annually to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary certifies Department managed health care plans under section 1705 as Medicare Choice organizations annually to the Secretary of Health and Human Services. Medicare payment for certain veterans under Section 1729A of title 38, United States Code, applies to care provided after the enactment of this Act.
